elements.text: PART TWO
COUPLE OF BEATS RUNNING UP OUTSIDE, THEN DOOR SLIDES OPEN. THE DOCTOR AND YCE BURST IN, CLOSELY FOLLOWED BY CONSTANCE AND FLORRIE.
Aryan?! Get up off the floor, you fool!
CONSTANCE AND FLORRIE ENTER.
Doctor, be careful!
(CROUCHING DOWN) There might still be a chance to (BEAT —
WYKE IS VERY DEAD) Oh...
Is he...?
(HAMMY SNIFFLES) Oh dear! Oh no!
I’m afraid so. Professor Wyke.. is dead.
SCENE CONTINUES:
21. j%QINT. YCE MINING CORP SITE OFFICES — ANALYSIS LAB [CONTINUED ]
What?! How could this have happened?!
It looks to me like he was electrocuted, but by what?

Is there an entry wound? Or a flash or exit burn? (BEAT) (KNOWING SHE’S LOOKING TOO SMART) Sorry, silly me — I watched an episode of ‘Galactamedics’ yesterday afternoon... it was all about this sort of stuff.
I see. Well, since you’ve mentioned it, I can’t find any sign of an exit burn. Mr Yce, I’d like to suggest that an urgent post-mortem is performed on this man.
#219: ABSOLUTE POWER by Jamie Anderson (FINAL) Page 36
Erm.. well, Doctor, I appreciate your concern, but that’s not Yce Corporation’s company policy. In the event of an accident, [all deaths...]
(INTERRUPTING) And what if the circumstances surrounding the death are highly unusual?
(SHAKEN) I’m not sure I like what you’re insinuating.
I’m not insinuating anything, Mister Yce. You appear to be inferring something though.
LIGHTING AND POWER RETURNS.
The power’s back on.
Indeed. Mister Yce — I believe that you were about to accede to my request?
There’s a well-equipped facility at the Ursa Aquarii Interplanetary University, but it’s two hours’ shuttle flight from here... and it’ll be expensive.
A man has died in suspicious circumstances. What price would you put on the safety of everyone at this site?
Very well, Doctor. You’ve made your point, but I really don’t know what you’re worrying about — this was clearly some unfortunate accident. Nonetheless — I will make the arrangements.
Thank you. (SPOTTING THE ARTEFACTS) Ah-ha! And are these the artefacts that you and the Professor were talking about? This metallic vessel, this cylinder and that rod?
ARRIVES, SKIDDING TO A HALT.
There you all are! I’ve been looking for you... for... a- ... (SPOTTING THE BODY) What’s happened here?
#219: ABSOLUTE POWER by Jamie Anderson (FINAL) Page 37
(DOWN) He’s dead. Professor Wyke is dead!
I’m sorry, Ammar. The Professor appears to have been working on these objects when [something happened and]
(INTERRUPTING) No! No, no no no...
HE TURNS, DOES A RUNNER.
(CALLING AFTER HIM) Ammar! Get back here! (BEAT) What’s wrong with you, man?
Doctor, should I...?
An excellent idea, Mrs Clarke. Thank you!
(RUNNING AND CALLING AFTER HIM) Ammar! Come back! It’s alright!
THEY RUN OFF DOWN THE CORRIDOR.
(EXAMINING THE ARTEFACTS) Mister Yce, I strongly suggest that these ‘artefacts’ are locked away somewhere safe!
Errrr.. and why [would that be, Doctor? ]
(PATRONISING. INSISTENT. INTERRUPTING) These are ancient artefacts, Mister Yce! They need to be looked after.
(RELIEVED NOT TO HAVE BEEN FOUND OUT) Oh! Yes, of course. Quite right! (BEAT) Florrie, my darling — could you fetch one of the lab technicians to arrange their safe storage?
Yes, of course. I’1l fetch the lab technician straight away.
TURNS AND EXITS.
And Mister Yce?
#219: ABSOLUTE POWER by Jamie Anderson (FINAL) Page 38
(NOW FRUSTRATED) Yes, Doctor?!
I also suggest a complete lockdown of all transport — of people and materials — in and out of this site. Agreed?
There’s something we can easily agree on, Doctor. Consider it done. (BEAT) Might I also suggest that any academic activities here are paused also?
Very well.
#219: ABSOLUTE POWER by Jamie Anderson (FINAL) Page 39
22. EXT. YCE MINING CORP SITE OFFICES — GANGWAY TO LAUNCH PADS
RUNS UP TO AMMAR. LIGHT WIND AND DUST STORM.
Ammar, wait, please! (BEAT) Wait!
GRABS HIS ARM AND PULLS HIM UP. RUNNING STOPS.
Please, let me go! I want to get out of here!
Ammar, it’s alright — it was an accident, most likely. Whatever is the matter?
I want to go. Please. Let me go!
Alright. If you’1l tell me what’s wrong. You know something, don’t you?
It’s not safe here, we need to leave. Please, you have to come with me too!
I’m flattered, but we’ve only just met.
(POLITE LAUGH) No, I didn’t mean... Sorry. Look, [we really]
(CALMLY INTERRUPTING) Ammar... Whatever it is you know, it might be important. It might even save lives.
Very well. During the early phases of this mining mission, I became aware of certain stories from Teymahrian history — regarding a mysterious object, and a cylindrical casket.
One of the ‘artefacts’ that Wyke was working on!
Perhaps. It’s little more than an ancient myth, but stories have been passed down around this system about an ancient god on Teymah, who derived his power from a special cylindrical casket.
#219: ABSOLUTE POWER by Jamie Anderson (FINAL) Page 40
I see...
The legends speak also of an ancient cult that tried to revive the banished god using the casket, but with the most terrible consequences.
The extinction event...?
Perhaps. As I say, it’s only a story, and maybe I’ve just lost my head over it all, but...
A little too much of it seems to fit our current situation for it to just be a story. (BEAT) Ammar, you need to share this information with the Doctor.
But I don’t want to!
(CHARMING) For me, Ammar? Please?
(SLIGHTLY FLUSTERED) Alright, Mrs Clarke.
Call me Constance. (BEAT) Come along!
AS THE DOCTOR APPROACHES. SLIGHTLY BREATHLESS.
Well done, Mrs Clarke! You caught up with our flighty friend, I
see.
Doctor! What on Earth happened in there?
It’s not safe here, Doctor. You must leave. We must all leave.
I think I’m beginning to share your concerns, Ammar, but for now at least — we must investigate further.
FX: THEY TURN AND QUICKLY WALK BACK TO THE SPHERE.
#219: ABSOLUTE POWER by Jamie Anderson (FINAL) Page 41
23. INT. YCE MINING CORP SITE OFFICES — CORRIDOR
This is an utter disaster. Just imagine the health and safety investigation... let alone the potential insurance claim, and the corresponding hike in our premiums!
I’1ll make my report as generic as I can, sir. I’ve moved the artefacts to the sample storage area in the medical bay.
Good. I suppose we’ll also need to arrange for this blasted autopsy.
Just let me know, sir. I’1ll do whatever you need.
Don’t worry. You will.
WALKS AWAY. DOOR OPENS. CROSS TO:
#219: ABSOLUTE POWER by Jamie Anderson (FINAL) Page 42
24. INT. YCE MINING CORP SITE OFFICES — YCE’S SUITE
IS IN THE MIDDLE OF A CALL.
I repeat — Wyke is dead. [He was]
OPENS. YCE ENTERS.
Florrie? Who are you calling?

(FLUSTERED. FAKING) So we’re confirmed? A shuttle will deliver the body within the next 24 to 36 hours. Thank you. (COMMS END) Sorry about that, darling — I wanted to get the post mortem arranged for poor Professor Wyke.
My dear, you didn’t have to do that. It’s rather a macabre duty for a pretty thing like you.
I know, Lyam, but... I just felt so helpless, and I wanted to do something useful. I’m sorry for interfering.
Not at all, my love. I’m very grateful. Come along, let’s go and inform the Doctor that the post mortem arrangements have been made.
GETS UP. THEY EXIT TOGETHER.
#219: ABSOLUTE POWER by Jamie Anderson (FINAL) Page 43
25. EXT. TEYMAH SURFACE — THE SPHERE
STORM BLOWS. VOICES RAISED OVER IT.
But does it make any sense, Doctor?
It’s not outside the realms of possibility that there’s some connection. (BEAT) Look at these!
The symbols?
I’m not surprised that your specialists failed to translate them.
Is it not some sort of ancient Teymahrian?

Almost certainly not. Luckily, we have a very talented cryptographer and linguist with us, in the form of Mrs Clarke. I did promise Yce that we wouldn’t carry on with our ‘academic duties’ — but there’s no harm in doing a little translation and code-breaking for fun, is there?
We can certainly give it a try, Doctor. After you.
Well, I can see that this symbol reappears multiple times, and this sequence here.. I recognise it from somewhere. I’m sure of it.
OUT.
#219: ABSOLUTE POWER by Jamie Anderson (FINAL) Page 44
26. INT. SICK BAY — WYKE’S POV
QUIET. A DOCTOR AND TECHNICIAN CAN BE HEARD (MUFFLED) ON THEIR
OUT.
I don’t understand why these old bits of junk need to be in my lab. (SIGHS) Any confirmation from the university hospital yet about the autopsy?
Nothing yet, doctor.
Yce’s bit of fluff organised it, did she? Useless girl.
Computer. Lights off.
FX: LIGHTS CLICK OFF. DOOR SHUTS. SILENCE. TWO SECONDS.
stored
(INSIDE BODY BAG: WAKES WITH A START, TAKING A HUGE BREATH. COUGHS. IT TAKES HIM A FEW SECONDS TO STABILISE HIS BREATHING)
HE UNZIPS THE BODY BAG FROM THE INSIDE AND CLIMBS OUT.
(NOW DISTORTED. CRACKLED. WHISPERED. WEAK) I must get to the
sphere.
HE EXITS.
#219: ABSOLUTE POWER by Jamie Anderson (FINAL) Page 45
27. EXT. TEYMAH SURFACE — THE SPHERE
STORM IS WORSE NOW. VERY LOUD. SAND HITS THE GROUP AND THE SPHERE.
. Well, that rules that one out. Hang on a mo!
GETS A NOTEBOOK OUT OF HIS POCKET.
I keep going back to that line of symbols there. I’m sure I recognise them.. Perhaps (FLICKING THROUGH NOTEBOOK) they’re in my notebook somewhere...
What about this sign, Doctor? It’s wing-like. Could it be a symbol for flight, or space travel?
It could well be... Do you have that section fully transcribed?
Almost everything from this panel, yes.
Doctor! Constance! The storm is getting too severe. We have to get back inside!
Don’t worry, Ammar. I think I have enough from here...
How come he’s allowed to call you Constance?!
Come along, please! Let’s get you inside!
THEY MAKE THEIR WAY FROM THE SPHERE ALONG THE NOISY GANGWAY.
#219: ABSOLUTE POWER by Jamie Anderson (FINAL) Page 46
28. INT. YCE MINING CORP SITE OFFICES — CORRIDOR
YCE AND FLORRIE WALKING.
Where has that curly-haired buffoon got to?
You mean the Doctor?
Yes... (MOCKINGLY) ‘The Doctor’. Something about him still makes me uncomfortable. Where’s he got to? Would you go wandering off in a situation like this?
OPENS. STORM BLOWS IN. DOCTOR, CONSTANCE, AMMAR ENTER.
There you are, Doctor! We were worried that perhaps you were lost?
I am never, ever lost!
Glad to have you back, Doctor. Has Ammar been keeping you entertained?
Very much so! We’ve been making some progress on translating the symbols on the sphere!
‘YOU'VE WHAT?!’ MUSIC STING
Have you indeed! I thought we’d agreed that all work should cease for the time being...
I’m sorry, sir, I wasn’t aware that there was a moratorium [on the U.A.X.S.’s work here]
(INTERRUPTING. COVERING) Well yes, but we took this on as more of a hobby-type activity...
CLEARS HER THROAT
Well, I say we — it’s Mrs Clarke who’s the real expert.
#219: ABSOLUTE POWER by Jamie Anderson (FINAL) Page 47
I see.. How dedicated you both are to your.. hobby. (BEAT) And what have you discovered so far, Mrs Clarke?
Well, Mr Yce, our efforts were cut short by this dust storm, but I’m fairly certain that the symbols are a set of instructions.
(SIMULTANEOUSLY) For what?
(SIMULTANEOUSLY) For what?
For some sort of religious ceremony, perhaps? It’s hard to tell until I can see more.
Most impressive, Mrs Clarke! (BEAT) I have an idea, regarding the second site...
Where you found more of the symbols?
Where we discovered the artefacts, too.. Restricted access, of course, Since the area has yet to be fully inventoried and catalogued, but you know what? I think I’1l allow you to take a look.
I’d certainly be keen to see it, once the dust storm’s passed.
(SEEING HIS CHANCE TO BE ALONE WITH CONSTANCE) Errr — I can take Mrs Clarke, sir? (RECOVERING PROFESSIONALISM) If that would help you, of course.
Thank you, Ammar. But I’d like to take our guest there personally. (BEAT) There’s no need to wait, Mrs Clarke! The second site is fully covered.. Perhaps we could go there now, in one of the buggies?
Doctor? Could you carry on with the Sphere transcriptions, while I go to work on the second site?
You don’t need my permission, Mrs Clarke.
#219: ABSOLUTE POWER by Jamie Anderson (FINAL) Page 48
In that case — I’m ready when you are, Mister Yce.
Absolutely! Florrie, my dear, will you look after the good Doctor?
Of course. Doctor, before you start work on the transcriptions — I expect you must be thirsty after all that time out in the dust storm?
I am indeed. Another layer of sand on the tongue, I’m afraid! You don’t happen to have any Ginger Beer do you?
Of course we do, Doctor.
Excellent. Well, I shall see you both when you get back!
Yes! Of course. Come along, Mrs Clarke. Uh’goobye!
THE FOUR GO THEIR TWO SEPARATE DIRECTIONS.
#219: ABSOLUTE POWER by Jamie Anderson (FINAL) Page 49
29. EXT. YCE MINING CORP SITE
STORM CONTINUES, AS WYKE LURCHES ALONG THE GANGWAY.
We have the items... (LURCHING ALONG) I can see the sphere... We. Will. Prevail.
SET OF FOOTSTEPS APPROACH ALONG THE GANGWAY.
Who’s that? (BEAT — GETTING CLOSER). (STUNNED) Professor Wyke?! But... I.. I thought you were...
Dead. Correct. (BEAT) Now, get out of my way!
IN SHOCK
But... I.. Your skin. It’s so pale. Are you... I don’t understand!
Move! Or I will kill you. (BEAT) Go!
#1: (IN SHOCK) What? Please! No! No! (HE LEGS IT) Help! Heeeeeelp!
FEET POUND ALONG THE GANGWAY AS THE STORM BLOWS HARDER.
#219: ABSOLUTE POWER by Jamie Anderson (FINAL) Page 50
30. INT. YCE MINING CORP SITE — CANTEEN
FADE UP. CANTEEN IS BUSY AND BUSTLING.
This is more like it. I must say — I do enjoy a touch of corporate hospitality every now and again!
You're easy to please, Doctor. Here’s your ginger beer!
THE DOCTOR TAKES A LARGE SWIG.
(VERY REFRESHED) That is an excellent ginger beer!
The best-selling brand in the galaxy, Doctor. Earth exports are big business throughout Ursa Aquarii. It’s how Lyam originally made his fortune!
Oh! Is this one of his exports?
It is. Yce is more of an empire than an enterprise!
Fascinating. If you don’t mind me asking — how did you and... Lyam meet?
It’s not much of a story, I’m afraid. (BEAT) About eleven months ago, I was working in a bar near one of Lyam’s corporate HQs — in a system not far from here...
OUT.
#219: ABSOLUTE POWER by Jamie Anderson (FINAL) Page 51
31. EXT. YCE MINING CORP SITE — BUGGY
PULLS UP JUST NEXT TO THE SECOND DIG SITE.
This is it, Constance... May I call you Constance?
You may.
We can walk the last part — it’s mostly under cover!
THEY EXIT THE VEHICLE. AS THE JOIN EACH OTHER ROUND THE FRONT:
How long have you been with the U.A.X.S., Constance?
Not long. I was brought in from another post to work as the Doctor’s.. assistant.
Assistant? I must say, you seem rather more than a mere assistant.
I’m flattered, Mister Yce. Working with the Doctor certainly keeps me on my toes! (BEAT) And what about you? What brings your operation to Teymah?

This barren place? Two reasons, really. Firstly commercial — Teymah is rich in a number of minerals that are rather valuable across this system — and only the Yce Corportation has the necessary processing technology, and the license to drill here... It’s a protected site, so it took us nearly four years to get the required paperwork from this sector’s governing body.
And the second?
A passing interest in Xenoarchaeology. I was rather hoping we might find something exciting during the mining...
And it seems you were right about that. You must be pleased!
#219: ABSOLUTE POWER by Jamie Anderson (FINAL) Page 52
Oh yes. It’s all coming together nicely — just a few kinks to iron out! (BEAT) Here we are — just up ahead.. can you see the entrance under the canopy just there?
THEY APPROACH THE DOOR.
#219: ABSOLUTE POWER by Jamie Anderson (FINAL) Page 53
32. INT. YCE MINING CORP SITE — CANTEEN
CANTEEN NOISE CONTINUES. DOCTOR PUTS HIS GLASS DOWN.
And of course, I had to say yes. I knew from that first day that he was the one for me.
A whirlwind romance, you might say?
I suppose so, Doctor. I know Lyam’s not perfect... but there’s something very special about him, something worth pushing through the initial ‘front’. And I think I’ve almost got past Des
Fascinating. He’s clearly a very lucky man.
Flattered, I’m sure, Doctor.
COMES THUNDERING IN. SOME DINERS DISTURBED.
(FRIGHTENED) Miss Solomon! Errr.. Florrie! Something has happened!
What is it, Ammar? The Doctor and I are having a [nice chat]
(INTERRUPTING) Please, Florrie. I’ve just received word that... (SWALLOWS HARD) Professor Wyke has been spotted in the compound. Walking around!
What?!
STAND UP, PUSHING BACK SEATS.
We need to find him, and quickly!
THEY DEPART.
#219: ABSOLUTE POWER by Jamie Anderson (FINAL) Page 54
33. EXT. YCE MINING CORP SITE — SECOND DIG SITE
YCE AND CONSTANCE WALK THROUGH THE DIG SITE.
He really is a rather odd fellow — your friend, ‘the Doctor...’
I don’t really know him that well, I’m afraid. You’re not suspicious of him, I hope, Mister Yce?
No, no, not suspicious. He just seems rather... eccentric. I was hoping you’d be able to fill me in on his background.
THEY STOP WALKING.
Not really. We’ve only been on a few trips together so far... Adventures, almost, you might say. (BEAT) My goodness! This is a temple, I think! — And just look at that...!
RUSHES OVER TO...
Mister Yce! Do you know what this is?!
(LYING) Just more of the inscriptions, I think?
I think it’s essentially a Rosetta Stone!
I don’t follow. A what? Will it help you decipher the symbols?
It’s the same inscription in several languages!
(KNOWS. STILL LYING) Is it?
Yes! And I can read one of them!! If we really work on it, this extra information could help us do it in weeks, or even days!

(CONCERNED. COVERING) Oh. (BEAT) Well... most impressive, Mrs Clarke! (BEAT) Please, excuse me for a moment. I’11 be back shortly. (LYING) I need to send a message back to the compound, and the dust storm is interfering with my personal communicator.
#219: ABSOLUTE POWER by Jamie Anderson (FINAL) Page 55

(BEAT — SHE’S ABSORBED BY THE SYMBOLS) Be my guest! I’1ll get to work here. Plenty to keep me busy — I’1l probably be tied up for hours working on these! But we should make very rapid progress now. This is a wonderful find!
(FAKING) So it seems. Good luck. See you very shortly!
HE LEAVES HER TO WORK.
#219: ABSOLUTE POWER by Jamie Anderson (FINAL) Page 56
34. EXT. TEYMAH SURFACE — THE SPHERE
DOCTOR, FLORRIE AND AMMAR MOVE AGAINST A TIDE OF RUNNING,
WORKERS.
Get out of here! / Get away! / It can’t be him!! / What’s the matter with him? / Run! Quickly! / Keep away from me!!
Excuse me! (BEAT) Please — stop! (BEAT) Won’t ell me what’s happening!
Doctor! Can it really be Wyke?
(ACCELERATING PANIC) It can’t be — we saw him earlier. He was dead! How can it be him?!
I’m not sure. I can’t get a sensible answer from any of the miners!
MORE WORKERS RUN TOWARDS THEM.
(FIRMLY GRABBING A WORKER) STOP!
#2: Let me go!! Please!
Not until you tell us what’s going on!
#2: It’s that Professor Wyke — the dead one — he’s beside the sphere!
Is he now?! What’s he doing there...?
Trying to open it...?
Who cares what he’s doing? He’s walking around like, like a zombie!!! Now please (SURGE OF EFFORT) Let me GO! (BREAKS FREE)
I can’t believe it!
#219: ABSOLUTE POWER by Jamie Anderson (FINAL) Page 57
Nor me, Ammar. Something very odd is going on. (BEAT. THOUGHTFUL) You’re rather stronger than you look, Florrie — arresting such a burly chap like that...
I’1ll take that as a compliment, Doctor.
Look, I suggest you two go back inside — get out of this storm, and try to raise Yce and Constance on the comms system. Get them back here as soon as possible!
Alright, Doctor. Then perhaps we should go to the stores and check for anything we could defend ourselves with?
(‘ODD’) That seems a little premature. But I suppose it might be sensible.
(WET. STROPPY) Are you suggesting we prepare for hand to hand combat with a zombie?! That is not in my employment contract!
Better safe than sorry!

Quite so (BEAT). I need to fetch something from my... conveyance, before I go to the sphere. I shall leave a note for Constance there too. Please — when you speak to her, will you tell her to go to there and read the note?
Of course! Let’s go. (BEAT) Come on, Ammar!
HAULS HIM WITH HER BY HIS SLEEVE.
(DRAGGED) (CHILDLIKE MOAN) Ooooohhh.
THEY PART WAYS.
#219: ABSOLUTE POWER by Jamie Anderson (FINAL) Page 58
35. EXT. YCE MINING CORP SITE — SECOND DIG SITE
IS ALONE, WORKING ON THE TRANSCRIPTION AND TRANSLATION.
SOTTO) I can read this, but.. I know it’s not English. (BEAT
This must be the TARDIS’ doing. Let’s see now...
EXAMINES THE STONE.
Well, I was right about one thing. The inscriptions on the sphere are almost certainly a set of instructions... but not for a religious ceremony.
#219: ABSOLUTE POWER by Jamie Anderson (FINAL) Page 59
36. INT. THE SPHERE
HUM. A STRANGE ENTRY CODER PULSE. SLIDING METAL AS THE
HATCHWAY OPENS. STORM OUTSIDE CAN BE HEARD.
MOANING AND WHISPERING TO HIMSELF, WYKE ENTERS. UNEVEN GAIT.
Back inside the sphere at last!
HE STAGGERS FURTHER IN.
Untouched for millennia...
HE ACCELERATES ACROSS THE FLOOR OF THE SPHERE AND ALMOST
ONTO A PANEL IN THE CENTRE.
The machine will be ready soon. Electromitosis awaits. (BEAT) Hurry, Yce. (GROWLED) HURRY!
#219: ABSOLUTE POWER by Jamie Anderson (FINAL) Page 60
37. INT. TARDIS CONSOLE ROOM
OPEN. DOCTOR RUSHES IN.
(RIFILING THROUGH POCKETS. PATTING HIMSELF DOWN) Pen. Pen? Pen! (BEAT) Ah ha!
HE SWIFTLY SCRAWLS A NOTE. HALF READING IT AS HE WRITES.

(MOSTLY UNINTELLIGIBLE) Dear Mrs Clarke. Read this carefully and follow my instructions to the letter. First — prime the telepathic circuits for a transmit and receive sequence — the orange and blue switches on the panel nearest the door.
OUT.
#219: ABSOLUTE POWER by Jamie Anderson (FINAL) Page 61
38. EXT. YCE MINING CORP SITE — SECOND DIG SITE
MAKES NOTES AND THINKS ALOUD.
So, I suppose in that context — this would mean ‘deriving power for...’ For what? For... erm... ‘awakening’? No — ‘revival’!
ARRIVES.
And how are we getting on, Mrs Clarke?

(REALLY QUITE ENTHUSED) Rather well actually, although I think you'll be surprised by what these say. You see this section here? So far as I can tell, the sphere was built by some alien species that arrived here centuries ago. I can’t translate the word that names the species, but these instructions somehow allow for the revival of that species. Something about diverting an underground river? Are there any rivers here — underground or otherwise?
APPROACHES AND STANDS DIRECTLY BEHIND HER.
(CONT’D) Mister Yce? (SHE TURNS) Mister Yce!? That’s one of those artefacts, you’re holding, isn’t it?
You are a clever one, aren’t you Mrs Clarke? I’m sorry to be so ungentlemanly about this...
STRIKES HER AROUND THE BACK OF THE HEAD, KNOCKING HER OUT COLD.
STRUCK
. but you’ve got too close to the truth for comfort. (BEAT) Now, let’s get you tied up, so you can be at the centre of the action!
LUGS HER UP AGAINST A PILLAR.
#219: ABSOLUTE POWER by Jamie Anderson (FINAL) Page 62
39. INT. YCE’S OFFICE
IS IN THE MIDDLE OF A COMMUNICATION TO AN UNKNOWN THIRD PARTY.
Look. I can’t make this any clearer to you. Stay in orbit!
(BADLY DISTORTED) Commander Kohrbal is not satisfied with your latest status report, agent. We are en route.
No, no, no! Everything is under control. Any interruption now
could ruin everything. Can’t you see that?
(BADLY DISTORTED) The decision has been made.
FOOTSTEPS ARRIVE OUTSIDE.
Someone’s coming. But do not come to Teymah!
OFF. DOOR OPENS. IT’S AMMAR — PANTING, DISTRESSED.
Miss Solomon! I was right! Yce — he’s taken the artefacts from
the store!! We must go after him!
Agreed. Come on, Ammar! We’1l take a buggy. I’11 drive!
THEY EXIT AT SPEED.
#219: ABSOLUTE POWER by Jamie Anderson (FINAL) Page 63
40. EXT. YCE MINING CORP SITE — SECOND DIG SITE — CONSTANCE
COMES ROUND SLOWLY. YCE’S MONOLOGUE BECOMES GRADUALLY CLEARER.
(WHILE CONCENTRATING. SETTING SOMETHING UP) What to do with the Doctor? Hmmmm. I suppose I’1l have to dispose of him as well.
(COMING ROUND. DISORIENTATED) Mr Yce? (BEAT) You... you hit me?
FEELS THE PAIN
Welcome back, Mrs Clarke. I’m afraid, though, that this is goodbye.
(STILL GETTING BEARINGS) And why is that?
Take a look around you. Do you see these compact little boxes strapped onto the temple pillars?
Yes...
Monodistronic explosives. Very destructive.
What on Earth are you playing at? Explain yourself right now [or I shall call the Doctor]
(INTERRUPTING) Shush now, Constance. (BEAT) It’s a shame. In any other situation, I’d have offered you a job. (BEAT)
Uh’ goobye!
ACTIVATES THE BOMBS, CLIMBS OUT OF THE DIG PIT AND SCARPERS. BEEPING OF MONODISTRONIC EXPLOSIVES.

(STRAINS TO ESCAPE) Ugh... Oh dear. I really should have paid more attention to that escapology course at Bletchley. (GIVES UP STRAINING) Nothing else for it I suppose. (BEAT) HELP! Heeeeeelllp! Help me! Doctor!? Anyone?!
NOTHING.
#219: ABSOLUTE POWER by Jamie Anderson (FINAL) Page 64
Oh well. It was worth a try.
IN THE DISTANCE THE BUGGY FIRES UP AND DRIVES AWAY.
And there he goes. What a delightful host! (CONTINUES TRYING TO ESCAPE).
#219: ABSOLUTE POWER by Jamie Anderson (FINAL) Page 65
41. INT. TARDIS CONSOLE ROOM
FINISHES HIS NOTE. LAST SCRIBBLES.
If all else fails, stay in the TARDIS. Good luck. (BEAT) P.S. Whatever you do, don’t leave the TARDIS! (BEAT) P.P.S. I mean it!
DOWN PEN.
(CONT’D) There!
HE PLACES THE NOTE ON THE CONSOLE. AND TURNS TO LEAVE.

COLLAPSES: ONTO A PANEL IN THE CENTRE.

WYKE: #219: ABSOLUTE POWER by Jamie Anderson (FINAL) Page 60
DOORS: OPEN. DOCTOR RUSHES IN.
DOCTOR: (RIFILING THROUGH POCKETS. PATTING HIMSELF DOWN) Pen. Pen? Pen! (BEAT) Ah ha!

DOCTOR: (MOSTLY UNINTELLIGIBLE) Dear Mrs Clarke. Read this carefully and follow my instructions to the letter. First — prime the telepathic circuits for a transmit and receive sequence — the orange and blue switches on the panel nearest the door.
FADING: OUT.

CONSTANCE: MAKES NOTES AND THINKS ALOUD.
CONSTANCE: So, I suppose in that context — this would mean ‘deriving power for...’ For what? For... erm... ‘awakening’? No — ‘revival’!
YCE: ARRIVES.
YCE: And how are we getting on, Mrs Clarke?
CONSTANCE: (REALLY QUITE ENTHUSED) Rather well actually, although I think you'll be surprised by what these say. You see this section here? So far as I can tell, the sphere was built by some alien species that arrived here centuries ago. I can’t translate the word that names the species, but these instructions somehow allow for the revival of that species. Something about diverting an underground river? Are there any rivers here — underground or otherwise?
YCE: APPROACHES AND STANDS DIRECTLY BEHIND HER.
CONSTANCE: (CONT’D) Mister Yce? (SHE TURNS) Mister Yce!? That’s one of those artefacts, you’re holding, isn’t it?
YCE: You are a clever one, aren’t you Mrs Clarke? I’m sorry to be so ungentlemanly about this...

YCE: . but you’ve got too close to the truth for comfort. (BEAT) Now, let’s get you tied up, so you can be at the centre of the action!
YCE: LUGS HER UP AGAINST A PILLAR.

FLORRIE: IS IN THE MIDDLE OF A COMMUNICATION TO AN UNKNOWN THIRD PARTY.
FLORRIE: Look. I can’t make this any clearer to you. Stay in orbit!
PHEENAN: (BADLY DISTORTED) Commander Kohrbal is not satisfied with your latest status report, agent. We are en route.
FLORRIE: No, no, no! Everything is under control. Any interruption now
FLORRIE: could ruin everything. Can’t you see that?
PHEENAN: (BADLY DISTORTED) The decision has been made.
RUNNING: FOOTSTEPS ARRIVE OUTSIDE.
FLORRIE: Someone’s coming. But do not come to Teymah!

AMMAR: Miss Solomon! I was right! Yce — he’s taken the artefacts from
AMMAR: the store!! We must go after him!
FLORRIE: Agreed. Come on, Ammar! We’1l take a buggy. I’11 drive!
FLORRIE: THEY EXIT AT SPEED.

CONSTANCE: COMES ROUND SLOWLY. YCE’S MONOLOGUE BECOMES GRADUALLY CLEARER.
YCE: (WHILE CONCENTRATING. SETTING SOMETHING UP) What to do with the Doctor? Hmmmm. I suppose I’1l have to dispose of him as well.

YCE: Welcome back, Mrs Clarke. I’m afraid, though, that this is goodbye.

CONSTANCE: What on Earth are you playing at? Explain yourself right now [or I shall call the Doctor]
YCE: (INTERRUPTING) Shush now, Constance. (BEAT) It’s a shame. In any other situation, I’d have offered you a job. (BEAT)
YCE: Uh’ goobye!
YCE: ACTIVATES THE BOMBS, CLIMBS OUT OF THE DIG PIT AND SCARPERS. BEEPING OF MONODISTRONIC EXPLOSIVES.
CONSTANCE: (STRAINS TO ESCAPE) Ugh... Oh dear. I really should have paid more attention to that escapology course at Bletchley. (GIVES UP STRAINING) Nothing else for it I suppose. (BEAT) HELP! Heeeeeelllp! Help me! Doctor!? Anyone?!
CONSTANCE: NOTHING.
CONSTANCE: #219: ABSOLUTE POWER by Jamie Anderson (FINAL) Page 64
CONSTANCE: Oh well. It was worth a try.

CONSTANCE: And there he goes. What a delightful host! (CONTINUES TRYING TO ESCAPE).

DOCTOR: FINISHES HIS NOTE. LAST SCRIBBLES.
DOCTOR: If all else fails, stay in the TARDIS. Good luck. (BEAT) P.S. Whatever you do, don’t leave the TARDIS! (BEAT) P.P.S. I mean it!

DOCTOR: (CONT’D) There!
DOCTOR: HE PLACES THE NOTE ON THE CONSOLE. AND TURNS TO LEAVE.
DOCTOR: Oops! (TURNS ON HIS HEEL) I almost forgot you!
DOCTOR: HE EJECTS THE MOBILE TELEPATHIC CIRCUIT FROM THE CONSOLE.
DOCTOR: I told Constance you’d come in handy at some point!
DOCTOR: HE EXITS.
DOCTOR: #219: ABSOLUTE POWER by Jamie Anderson (FINAL) Page 66
QUIET: EXCEPT FOR A LIGHT WIND.
CONSTANCE: Anyone?! (BEAT) Help! (BEAT) Help me, please!

CONSTANCE: Oh dear. This is all looking rather bleak.

ADVANCED: ALIEN SHIP PREPS FOR FLIGHT. A NEW SOUNDSCAPE. SMALL
CRAFT: FOR A SMALL CREW.
KOHRBAL: Well?
PHEENAN: Sir, I can’t raise her.
KOHRBAL: Then the decision is made. How long to Teymah?
PHEENAN: A little over four minutes, Sir.
KOHRBAL: Proceed!
SHIP: POWERS UP AND PUNCHES OFF INTO SPACE.
SHIP: #219: ABSOLUTE POWER by Jamie Anderson (FINAL) Page 68
WORKERS: CAN STILL BE HEARD RUNNING AND SCREAMING OUTSIDE. WYKE IS IN THE SPHERE. VERY LOW RATE, LOW LEVEL ALIEN HUM CAN BE HEARD. WYKE CRACKLES WITH ENERGY AND NOW HAS A DISTORTED VOICE.
WYKE: Hurry, Yce. The Ninexie require you to deliver on your promises.
WYKE: BREATHES HEAVILY AS HE MOVES EQUIPMENT AND ARTEFACTS AROUND THE SPHERE’S CENTRAL CHAMBER.
WYKE: We were so close... but after that interminable wait, finally — it is our time.
STOPS: WHAT HE’S DOING AND FOCUSES ON THE INTRUDER.
WYKE: Get out! Keep away! If you wish to live you will leave this place.
WYKE: THE DOCTOR STEPS INTO THE CHAMBER.
DOCTOR: Are those my only two options? (BEAT) I say, Professor Wyke. You’re looking rather... peaky. You do know that you were dead earlier?
WYKE: Enough, Doctor. Leave this place, or I shall destroy you.
DOCTOR: I was rather hoping for a little more conversation, Wyke. You are Professor Wyke, aren’t you?
WYKE: As you said, Doctor. Wyke is dead. Now — GO!
DOCTOR: Wyke is dead, and yet you know my name. (BEAT) So you — whatever you are — have access to Wyke’s memories?
WYKE: We have access to all of Wyke’s memories.
WYKE: #219: ABSOLUTE POWER by Jamie Anderson (FINAL) Page 69
DOCTOR: A parasite? Is that what’s in there? (BEAT) Yes! You — the creature I’m speaking to — you’re using Wyke’s corpse as a host — a temporary shell. (BEAT) Go on! (GAMESHOW STYLE) Introduce yourself! What’s your name, and where do you come from? (BEAT)
DOCTOR: (MAINTAINING OVERLY JOVIAL TONE) Alright, I’ll start, if you’re feeling shy. (CLEARS THROAT). I’m the Doctor, and I’m from Gallifrey in the constellation of Kasterborous. My hobbies include...
WYKE: (INTERRUPTING) Enough, Time Lord!
DOCTOR: Ah, so you know Gallifrey?
WYKE: The Ninexie know your race.
DOCTOR: The Ninexie? Now, where have I heard that name before? You’re not related to the Nix are you?
WYKE: We are not, Doctor.
DOCTOR: Not terribly chatty, are you? — So, what is this sphere, then? What’s its purpose? Obviously, it’s not a ship. So if you’re not trying to escape, then what are you up to? Fairly sparsely decorated... but this central console looks interesting. Some sort of generator, perhaps?
DOCTOR: A COUPLE OF FOOTSTEPS, SKID TO A HALT. GUN COCKED.
DOCTOR: Oh no.
YCE: Oh yes, Doctor. How good to see you again. (BEAT) I’11 guard him, Wyke. You may continue with the procedure.
WYKE: Is the secondary chamber prepared?
YCE: Of course, I have the trigger device here.
YCE: #219: ABSOLUTE POWER by Jamie Anderson (FINAL) Page 70
YCE: HE HOLDS IT UP. IT’S LIVE. BEEPING.
DOCTOR: I should have realised earlier about you, Yce. Far too smarmy to be one of the ‘good guys’. (BEAT — SEES THE DETONATOR) Is
DOCTOR: that the trigger for a monodistronic charge?
YCE: Very observant, Doctor.
DOCTOR: I try! (BEAT) And what exactly is it that you’re blowing up, Yce? Monodistronic explosives are incredibly powerful...
YCE: (SARCASTIC) That’s a relief, Doctor. I was concerned they wouldn’t be powerful enough to do the job!
DOCTOR: Which is?
YCE: To divert an underground river near the second dig site through the ancient channels that run beneath this structure.
DOCTOR: But why, Yce?! (BEAT) Hang on — where’s Constance?
WYKE: Everything is ready, Yce. Now.
DOCTOR: (CONCERNED/ANGRY) Where is Constance?!
YCE: Oh, Doctor. You really should be more careful with your pets!
DOCTOR: No! What have you done with her?!
YCE: I’m afraid that poor Constance is about to be involved ina tragic accident. Shame she got so ‘tied up’ at the second dig Site, but really — she only has herself to blame.
DOCTOR: No, Yce, stop!
DOCTOR: LUNGES TO GRAB DETONATOR BUT IS GRABBED BY WYKE. WYKE’S
GRASP: IS ELECTRICALLY CHARGED AND IS PAINFUL FOR THE DOCTOR.

DOCTOR: Argh! (BEAT. CONFUSED) Ow. You shocked me, Wyke.. an electric shock...!
WYKE: I have him, Yce. Continue.
YCE: Gladly (BEAT) Sorry, Doctor — but Mrs Clarke is out of time.
YCE: HE PRIMES THE DETONATOR. BEEP BEEP.
DOCTOR: (STRUGGLING) No!!
DUST: STORM BLOWS THROUGH THE SITE. THE BOMBS PRIME. ACTIVATION PIPS. FIVE. FOUR. THREE.

DOCTOR: (RESTRAINED AND IN PAIN) Yce! Whatever you’re doing here, Constance isn’t a threat to you! Please! Stop!
DOCTOR: TWO. ONE. BOOM. EXPLOSION SHAKES THE SURFACE.
DOCTOR: Yce! (WYKE’S GRIP TIGHTENS. DOCTOR DROPS TO HIS KNEES IN PAIN)
YCE: Oh, shush now Doctor! It’s too late. She’s dead! .. And soon you

YCE: END OF PART TWO

elements.text: PART THREE
(RESTRAINED AND IN PAIN) Yce! Whatever you’re doing here, Constance isn’t a threat to you! Please! Stop!
TWO. ONE. BOOM. EXPLOSION SHAKES THE SURFACE.
Yce! (WYKE’S GRIP TIGHTENS. DOCTOR DROPS TO HIS KNEES IN PAIN)
Oh, shush now Doctor! It’s too late. She’s dead! .. And soon you will be, too!
47. INT. THE SPHERE [CONTINUED]
(HEAVY HEARTED) Constance! (BEAT) But why, Yce? Why have you done this?
The river we’ve diverted will flow under the sphere, powering it up using the Ninexie technology, and then I get my reward. (BEAT) Ah — I hear water!
NOISE BECOMES APPARENT. AFTER A FEW SECONDS, IT’S
RUNNING WATER. A HUGE UNDERGROUND RIVER IS SUDDENLY
BENEATH THE SPHERE. MACHINERY IN THE SPHERE BEGINS TO
UP.
Very good, Yce. The Doctor here has misled us — he is in fact, a Time Lord.
A what?
An alien. An imposter, Yce. Very much like our friend Wyke
here!
BECOMES MORE ACTIVE.
#219: ABSOLUTE POWER by Jamie Anderson (FINAL) Page 74
Do be quiet, Doctor. I know he’s a Ninexis now. What do you take me for? (BEAT) Wyke — when do we get the power?
Very soon. The new Ninexis progeny will be generated in a few minutes’ time.
Yce.. you knew that the revival of these... things... these parasites, would kill Wyke?!

I had my suspicions. Even if you and your pet hadn’t arrived, then I’d still have let Wyke initiate the ceremony. That’s business, Doctor — if someone else can take the risk, but you still profit — that’s the way to go!
What noble means.
The means are not important. The result is all that matters!
And what result are you hoping for?
What every being truly desires, Doctor. Absolute power over life and death!
This doesn’t make any sense, Yce. Are you so blinded by your desire for power that you can’t see what is actually happening here?!
Do elaborate, Doctor! I’m fascinated. (YAWNS)
Well, I... haven’t quite worked it out myself yet, but...
Why doesn’t that surprise me? From the moment I met you I could see your mouth moved far quicker than your brain, Doctor.
Enough! Both of you! The device is not working at full capacity. Assist me, Yce!
#219: ABSOLUTE POWER by Jamie Anderson (FINAL) Page 75
I’m not really a hands-on sort of entrepreneur, Wyke.
The console in the centre? I’m not entirely familiar with the controls, but I think I can see how it works... What exactly is the device, Wyke?
A generator, Doctor. We need electricity to reproduce.
Electromitosis, eh? Fascinating. You know — I remember reading about it at the academy back on Gallifrey, but I’ve never met a lifeform that uses it to procreate.
I’m glad we could assist with your continuing professional development, Doctor.
Quite. Most kind. By the way — just from some brief observation, I’d say that your main issue is a corroded resistance nanomodulator.
And what would your solution be, Doctor?
Well, it just so happens that I have a similar piece of technology in my pocket — I carry around all sorts of things you see...
Obviously a trap, Doctor. A pathetic plan, from a pathetic man.
It’s really not. (BEAT) I’m rather hoping if I can prove useful to you, you’ll spare my life and not use me as a host body when the next Ninexis is... produced!
An interesting proposition, Doctor. (BEAT) Yce — find the device.
Very well. Hands on your head, Doctor.
(RAISING HANDS) Alright, alright. It’s in...
DIVES FOR HIS RIGHT POCKET.
#219: ABSOLUTE POWER by Jamie Anderson (FINAL) Page 76
(ALARMED) .. my left pocket!
CHANGES POCKETS.
And what am I looking for?
A small, cylindrical device...
(TAKING SOMETHING OUT) This?
No — that’s a yo-yo.
DROPS THE YOYO AND TAKES SOMETHING ELSE OUT.
This?
That’s it. It should actually fit directly in line with that part of the circuit, Wyke.
Give it to me.
But what if it’s [a trap]
(INTERRUPTING) I’m not an idiot, Yce. I am myself electrical in nature. I can check its function by passing myself through it.

PASSES HIS ELECTROPARASITE THROUGH THE DEVICE. HE HISSES AND GROWLS AS THE PARASITE RUNS FROM HIS INDEX FINGERS TO THUMB. A FEW SPARKS. WHEN THE PARASITE RETURNS TO WYKE HE REACTS AND IS MORE BREATHLESS INITIALLY.
Well?
He appears to be telling the truth. Thank you Doctor, you have been most helpful.
Well, I know when I’m beaten!
#219: ABSOLUTE POWER by Jamie Anderson (FINAL) Page 77
BEGINS FITTING THE ITEM. A FEW CLICKS AND SCRAPES. THE
POPS INTO PLACE. THE GENERATOR CONITNUES POWERING UP.
#219: ABSOLUTE POWER by Jamie Anderson (FINAL) Page 78
48. INT. GALAXY 3 SPACECRAFT
ALIEN SHIP IN FLIGHT. SMALL CRAFT FOR A SMALL CREW.
Commencing final approach, sir. I’1l plot a landing course that avoids the debris and smoke from that blast.
Was that her? (BEAT) Explosions don’t really seem her style.
It could have been. Her tracer suggests she is close to the location of the explosion.
Is she... err...
Alive? Yes, sir. She’s moving away from the explosion location back towards the sphere.
Shame. Would have made things a little more... neat.
Sir?
Never mind. Take the ship down as soon as you’re ready — as close to the sphere as you can. We need to finish this.
FLIES PAST.
#219: ABSOLUTE POWER by Jamie Anderson (FINAL) Page 79
49. EXT. YCE MINING CORP SITE — SECOND DIG SITE
CRACKLE AND BURN. DEBRIS IS STILL FALLING.
(CLEARLY CONCERNED. COUGHING) Constance? (BEAT) Constance! !
(COUGHING) Don’t worry Ammar, she’s fine. As am I — thank you for asking! (BEAT) We got her out just in time.
(COMES ROUND ABRUPTLY. COUGHING AND SPLUTTERING) Ammar! Florrie!? (CATCHING HER BREATH) What on Earth? (SEES DESTRUCTION) What!? What happened?
You don’t remember? Ammar and I got to you just in time, moments before the charges went off.
You did?
You hit your head when we dived for cover. But you’re safe now. Come, we need to get back to the buggy.
It was Yce. He led me here. He knocked me out. He tried to kill me!
I’m sorry, Constance. I should have stopped him sooner.
What?! You knew... what he was planning?
Not quite. It’s complicated. Anyway — you have Ammar to thank. He alerted me.
THEY STOP.
I was worried about you, Constance. I discovered Yce had taken explosives from storage, so I alerted Florrie. We found Yce’s
buggy and observed from a distance. But we knew if I tried to
stop Yce, he would have killed us.
#219: ABSOLUTE POWER by Jamie Anderson (FINAL) Page 80
Or at least, he’d have tried...
We had to let him think he hadn’t been seen. I’m sorry!
Sorry?! Ammar, I really couldn’t be more grateful. Thank you, both of you.
(VERY EMBARRASSED) I couldn’t let anything happen to you, Constance.
GENTLY CLEARS THROAT
SILENCE.
Yes. Well, thank you. Really. I mean it. (BEAT) Anyway — what’s going on? What’s Yce playing at? And where’s the Doctor?
He’s in the Sphere with Wyke. Yce too, I expect. We have to get back there!
THE GALAXY 3 SHIP FLIES OVERHEAD DISRUPTING THE CONVERSATION. IT FADES AND HEADS IN TO LAND THROUGH:
Gosh! Another spaceship?
Strange...
(COVERING) Ah, I think Lyam mentioned some other visitors, so. Yes — it’s probably them.
OK — let’s get back to the sphere. We’1l fill you in on what we know on the way, Constance! Some interesting information has come to light. We’ll take the buggy.
RUSHES AROUND AND TRIES TO START THE BUGGY. IT FAILS TO
UP.
Yes, and I have a confession to make... but [let’s]!
#219: ABSOLUTE POWER by Jamie Anderson (FINAL) Page 81
Dammit!! There is dust clogging the engines. From the explosion. It won’t start!
Well, then — we’1ll have to walk back, I suppose.
THEY HEAD FOR THE DOME THROUGH THE SAND.
#219: ABSOLUTE POWER by Jamie Anderson (FINAL) Page 82
50. INT. THE SPHERE
SOUNDS IN BETTER NICK NOW. POWERING UP MORE CLEANLY.
Very good, Doctor! Your assistance will not go unrewarded.
Oh, I require no reward. But I would like to understand a little more about what’s going on here...
Very well. Yce will benefit from a little education too, I think.
PffffFfftt. If we must.
INTO NARRATED FLASHBACK — ‘DREAMY’.
Three thousand years ago, I landed here in a colonisation pod.
THUNDERS THROUGH THE ATMOSPHERE AND STRIKES THE GROUND ON TEYMAH.
It has always been the Ninexie way to launch these pods, and it is a noble thing to be chosen to travel and extend the Ninexie reach into the universe.
SOUNDS OF INTERSTELLAR WAR. LASER FIRE. SHIPS. EXPLOSIONS. SPARKS. LIGHTENING. HISSING. SCREAMING.
An attempted invasion and subsequent interstellar war led to a dramatic increase in our rate of emigration. (BEAT) After almost a hundred years in transit — my pod struck the surface of Teymah.
FIRES THROUGH THE ATMSOPHERE AND HITS THE GROUND. AS THE SMOKE AND DEBRIS CLEARS, AND WITH THE PASSING OF TIME:
What is it? / A gift from the gods? / Don’t go near it! / Keep away! / Argh! It’s hot!! Hotter than the sun! / Get the master Shayman! / etc.
GATHER AROUND THE POD AS IT HISSES AND CRACKLES. AS IT OPENS THE NINEXIS ‘JUMPS’ OUT AND TAKES OVER ONE OF THE PEOPLE. OTHERS RUN IN FEAR.
#219: ABSOLUTE POWER by Jamie Anderson (FINAL) Page 83
I found a host upon landing, but the primitive people of this world had prophesised the arrival of a god... (SELF OBSESSED.
PUNCTUATED) I was that god!
CHANTING AROUND A FIRE. ANIMAL SKIN DRUM IN TIME.
Hah-va nay. Tey-ma ra. Hah-va nay. Tey-ma ra.

But our method of colonisation requires a certain level of technical and scientific ability on the part of the existing civilisation, but Teymah was too primitive. My only recourse was to use the Teymahrians as hosts, and attempt to accelerate their scientific development.
#219: ABSOLUTE POWER by Jamie Anderson (FINAL) Page 84
51. INT. GALAXY 3 SPACECRAFT
PART OF LANGING. LANDED AND POWERING DOWN.
Does this Ninexis know that its world has been destroyed?
Extremely unlikely, but we can’t risk young ‘Florrie’ breaking the news to it.
What if she does?
We have to make sure that, whatever happens — the Ninexis is destroyed.
How do we do that?
Prime the ship’s self-destruct mechanism.
Sir?

Just an insurance policy, Pheenan. Should we fail to destroy the Ninexis, or if it has already started reproducing then we destroy the ship — destroying the Ninexis sphere and any potential hosts for for more of them.
(PANICKED) Sir?!
I thought you were dedicated to the cause, Pheenan?
I am, sir, but there must be nearly a hundred people at this Site — they’1ll all be killed.
A small price to pay to complete our mission — wouldn’t you agree? (BEAT) Good — come along! Bring the remote, and the cage.
(SIGHS) Yes. Sir.
THEY EXIT.
#219: ABSOLUTE POWER by Jamie Anderson (FINAL) Page 85
52. EXT. YCE MINING CORP SITE — SECOND DIG SITE
THEY MOVE QUICKLY THROUGH THE SAND.
But then this... creature... used its power to form a cult around itself? I saw some references to that in the temple inscriptions!
That is what the legends appear to say.
It’s much more than a legend, Ammar.
But then somehow this cult caused the extinction of the entire Teymahrian race? It seems a little unlikely.
The Teyhmarian writings only go so far before mentions of the god and his cult begin to disappear, and then only the inscriptions remain — the ones you’ve been trying to translate.
I see. And where do you come in to all this, Florrie? I’m none the wiser about you and your role.

ARE HEATING UP IN THE SPHERE.

WYKE: SOUNDS OF INTERSTELLAR WAR. LASER FIRE. SHIPS. EXPLOSIONS. SPARKS. LIGHTENING. HISSING. SCREAMING.

TEYMAHRIANS: What is it? / A gift from the gods? / Don’t go near it! / Keep away! / Argh! It’s hot!! Hotter than the sun! / Get the master Shayman! / etc.

FINAL: PART OF LANGING. LANDED AND POWERING DOWN.

I saw no option but to make the inscriptions in the last days in my host body... it was too weak to do anything else. (BEAT) It was one of the most tortuous and dreadful decisions... to consign myself to a potential forever of loneliness...

CONSTANCE: We’re almost ready for you Doctor... good luck, whatever it is

elements.text: PART FOUR
You — the Commander’s underling. What did you mean, about not wanting to die?
Yes, I wondered that myself.
Our ship isn’t just a flight vessel. It’s a bomb. A category nine destruction rig. The Commander primed its self-destruct, as he died.
Oh, no...
In just over sixty seconds’ time, it’ll explode - taking half this planet with it!

68. INT. THE SPHERE [CONTINUOUS]
Well, can’t you shut it off?
Yes, disarm it. At once!
I can’t. Not from here. (RESIGNED) The mission will be completed.
No!!!
#219: ABSOLUTE POWER by Jamie Anderson (FINAL) Page 111
69. INT. GALAXY 3 SPACECRAFT
SELF DESTRUCT PIPS WITH WARNINGS EVERY FIFTEEN SECONDS. DRAMATIC PRESSURISED MUSIC BED.
Well, how do we disable it?
It’s not really designed to be disabled.
What?!
The kill switch can be activated from here...
Alright, but...?
